sub_title: Leads Transformational Change ✹Action-Oriented, Pragmatic Planner & Organiser Extraordinaire ✹Autism & Disability Advocate
summary:
Straight-talking, pragmatic, results- & customer-focused general manager. Good at getting things done and a fan of the Agile mindset. Excellent stakeholder management skills across product, technology, sales & marketing teams. Well-practiced herder of cats. 

A confident, decisive, principled & culturally aware leader, experienced in working with diverse global teams. Embeds cultural & organisational change by defining and role modelling core principles, & by using influencing skills to engage employees across functions into multi-disciplinary teams. Open communication style and good at forging trusting relationships with (internal) customers, clients, governments, KOLs & academics.

Strong track record of aligning business objectives with identified market opportunities to create strategic business competencies, both cultural and product, that provide a defensible competitive advantage. A subject-matter expert in creating actionable insights from big data.

Specialities:
✹Transformation ✹Change Management ✹Organisational change ✹Team Culture ✹Agile Mindset & Way of Working ✹Agile & Waterfall Project Management ✹Personal Development ✹Diversity & Inclusion ✹Disability Enablement ✹Communications ✹Strategic Development & Direction Setting ✹Leadership ✹Analytics & Insights ✹Strategic Alliances ✹New Business Development ✹New Product Development ✹Go-to-Market Strategies ✹Big Data Analytics ✹Mergers & Acquisitions ✹Research Intelligence ✹B2B SaaS ✹Public Relations (PR)

authors.headline: Leads Transformational Change ✹Action-Oriented, Pragmatic Planner & Organiser Extraordinaire ✹Autism & Disability Advocate

courses.name: Nederlands als Tweede Taal (Dutch as a Second Language)

profile_positions.description:
Accountable for change delivery in Research Marketing organisation to create a more customer-centric, outcome-focused business model with happier, more satisfied team members. As right hand to the EVP Research Marketing, this newly created role led the delivery phase of a transformation from three traditional, globally dispersed, marketing teams into a single digital marketing organisation. Subsequently project managed the (remote) self-selection of 130 people into a squad structure together with the flip to a fully Agile way of working.

First point of contact for team culture including diversity & inclusion, Agile mindset and customisations per squad; change touchpoints relating to HR including personal development frameworks at different employee lifecycle stages, training and advising on talent profiles, Works Council liaison; departmental performance dashboard; communications; governance including budget; new process development.
profile_positions.title: Chief of Staff, Research Marketing

profile_positions.description: Strengthening and empowering the close community of people impacted by disability at Elsevier so that we can build awareness of its impact on individuals and the teams they work in. Using this awareness to educate all of our colleagues about the unique contributions that people with disabilities can make to our business success, and the small steps that everyone can easily take to ensure that we enjoy those benefits. Influencing policies, processes and tools to level the playing field for all talent, current and future.
profile_positions.title: Chair, Elsevier Enabled ERG

profile_positions.description:
Enabled’s goal is to ensure that Elsevier is a psychologically safe, engaging & empowering workplace for people with disabilities & people with caring responsibilities, by embedding disability inclusion into every stage of the employee lifecycle. 

Accountable for the communications strategy to establish Elsevier as a proactive advocate for disability inclusion & an employer of choice for People with Disabilities; and for professionalising the ERG’s way of working as it transitions from start-up to scale-up.
profile_positions.title: Communications Officer and Steering Committee member, Elsevier Enabled ERG

profile_positions.description:
Newly created role, mandated to leverage partnerships to develop grassroots, standardized cross-solution approach to converting big data into actionable analytics & insights to evaluate, showcase, & scenario model research status. Developed & executed Elsevier analytics & insights strategy, & played a key role in the due diligence process for a new acquisition. 

Successfully launched two new analytics products in 2016; pioneered introduction of novel research metrics into Elsevier (based on usage of solutions, patents, online social activity & media intentions), developing a novel freemium model. Received Special Recognition Award from Research Solutions Sales (2016). 

Established global reputation as a subject-matter expert, speaking at events; publishing white papers & original research; reviewing original submissions for several journals; & Editorial Board Member of European Science Editing (2019-present).
profile_positions.title: Director of Analytics & Insights ("Research Metrics")

profile_positions.description:
Newly defined role that forged, developed & maintained strategic alliances with key influencers in major academic & governmental organizations with global influence, building a favorable impression of Elsevier as a trusted partner to provide analytics in scholarly research.

Successfully launched two new products (SciVal & Snowball Metrics); a key part of due diligence for M&A & subsequent launch of derived analytics solutions; received award for establishment of relationships with academic leaders.
profile_positions.title: Senior Manager Strategic Alliances

profile_positions.description: Appointed as Product Manager & rapidly progressed to Senior Product Manager; part of original start-up incubator team that developed the Research Intelligence (analytics & insights) business area for Elsevier; launched new product & pioneered Elsevier's journey with High-Performance Cluster Computing (HPCC); identified as a high-potential leader & selected for the Reed Elsevier Talent Program.
profile_positions.title: Senior / Product Manager

profile_positions.description: Successfully supported internal stakeholders, namely publishing, sales and strategy, in building networks with influencers in scientific journal community (journal editors & learned societies), by preparing & drawing insights from analytics reports; insights gained led to improved quality of content & strategic scope adjustments.
profile_positions.title: Data Analyst

profile_positions.description: Owned two scientific portfolios, Animal Science and Forensic Science & Medicine; digitized traditional print journal portfolios; developed affiliations with learned societies & academic communities; identified opportunities for acquisitions, non-subscription revenue, & book & journal launches.
profile_positions.title: Junior / Publishing Editor
